posts.content:
WE'RE LIVE!

Day 1 Speakers - January 22

915AM MT- RevOps and Enablement Synergy - A practical guide to integrating Revenue Operations and Enablement through the L.I.T. Framework for improved organizational alignment and outcomes.

10AM MT -- Sales Leadership Blueprint: step-by-step strategies to transform overwhelmed managers into confident leaders, enabling them to inspire their teams and achieve sustained success through proactive leadership practices.

10:20 AM MT -Gender Gap in Sales: the challenges women face in tech sales, explore the impact of inclusivity on revenue, and learn actionable solutions to bridge the gender gap through equitable practices and mentorship.

10:40 AM MT â€“Closing the Gap Between Sales Enablement and Sales Empowerment.

11:00 AM MT â€“The 4x4 Method: The Silicon Valley Secret to Exponential Growth - A framework for goal setting, strategic planning, and daily execution to achieve measurable personal and professional growth.

1145 AM MT â€“and I are up!â€“ AI Will Expose the Mediocre - A panel discussion exploring how AI amplifies both strengths and weaknesses, the dangers of over-reliance on general AI models, and strategies for integrating AI effectively without compromising.

1230 PM MT â€“From Opener to Booked Meeting: A step-by-step walkthrough of an effective cold calling flow, covering openers, pitches, handling objections, and securing meetings.

1250PM MT â€“3 Things Ruining Your Pipeline: An in-depth look at the top issues affecting sales pipelines, including rot dates, pipeline shapes, and hygiene, along with actionable solutions to address them effectively.

L*nk in comments

posts.name:
Suman Yadav
Suman Yadav
posts.content:
3 things I stopped doing and I'm happy I did that
(and you should too!)


1. saying yes to everything
It only drains your energy.
Start prioritizing what's really important.


2. overthinking people's opinions
Peopleâ€™s opinions arenâ€™t bills - you donâ€™t have to pay them.


3. scrolling aimlessly
I replaced 30 minutes of scrolling with 30 minutes of learning something new, and the results are surprising!




What it taught me:

-the importance of setting boundaries.
-how to stay focused on my goals.



Actionable tip:

Write down 3 things you need to stop doing today.
You'll be surprised how light you'll feel once you start.


ï¸ which one worked for you?

(repost this further to help your network ï¸)


and followto make your scrolling on linkedin valuable and interesting ï¸:)

comments.commentText: Saying No is a strong personality development trait that we all need to learn Suman Yadav . And cutting off screen time is actually something that I've been trying to learn of late.

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Setting boundaries is key to productivity. I love the idea of replacing scrolling with learningâ€”such a game changer! ğŸŒŸ

posts.name:
Jay Thanki
Jay Thanki
posts.content:
Top 20 Excel Functions
-----------------------------------------
Below are some of the most commonly used Excel functions.

SUM: Adds values in a range of cells
AVERAGE: Calculates the average of a set of values across a range of cells
VLOOKUP: Searches for a value in the first column of a table and returns a value in the same row from a specified column
XLOOKUP: Searches for a value to the left and/or right of a lookup array
MAX: Returns the highest value in a range of cells
MIN: Returns the lowest value in a range of cells
IF: Performs conditional tests, returning different values depending on whether a given condition is true or false
COUNT: Counts the number of cells in a range that contains numbers
INDEX: Returns the value of a cell in a specified range based on its row and column numbers
MATCH: Searches for a specified value in a range of cells and returns the relative position of that value within the range
CONCATENATE: Joins two or more strings of text together
LEFT: Extracts a specified number of characters from the beginning (left side) of a string of text
RIGHT: Extracts a specified number of characters from the end (right side) of a string of text
MID: Returns a specified number of characters from the middle of a string of text
LEN: Returns the number of characters (character count) in a string of text
TRIM: Removes leading and trailing spaces from a string of text
ROUND: Rounds a number to a specified number of decimal places
TODAY: Returns the current date
NOW: Returns the current date and time
DATE: Returns the serial number of a date
TIME: Returns the serial number of a time
posts.commentAdded: Great summary! Mastering these Excel functions can truly enhance productivity and data analysis skills. Which one do you use most often?

posts.name:
Yonesy NÃºÃ±ez
Yonesy NÃºÃ±ez
posts.content:
A lot of people are apprehensive about AI adoption. 

It's understandable because there's a lot of talk going around about AI replacing workers. But, ultimately, AI needs us -- for moderation, operation, and proper applications.

AI can be used for people and with people, not instead of them. Workers can be upskilled to utilize AI for their companies, creating new opportunities and even jobs, instead of reducing them.

Get curious about AI and how you can contribute or benefit from it, both personally and professionally. You might be pleasantly surprised.
posts.commentAdded: Absolutely! Embracing AI can enhance our skills and drive innovation. Lets focus on collaboration between humans and technology! ğŸš€

posts.content:
Had a first where a COO overruled the CEO because they "needed to think through their holistic Generative AI strategy across the company"  

That's like saying "We aren't going to implement the internet until we know how finance will use it and how that aligns with sales"

What did I do? I felt "compelled" to let the CEO what a mistake this was

His response? 

Jake: "I don't get bitter when I lose deals"

KD: "You know anything you preface like that means 100% you do...and that's ok"

Jake: "Maybe... "

New podcast episode dropped today...make sure to check out the full episode on YouTube or your favorite podcast platform

Amazing tactical value...and some fun too
posts.commentAdded: Insightful discussion! Its crucial to embrace innovation without getting mired in analysis paralysis. Looking forward to the episode! ğŸ§
